newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore bunkers up on perceived firm cargo level.
newsitem.headline: Singapore bunkers up on perceived firm cargo level.

text.p: Singapore bunkers opened firmer amid expectations that cargo prices will rise further, brokers said on Monday.

The high prices are scaring away buyers, said a trader. A shipowner said he intends to cover his requirement of around 3,000 tonnes from South Korea, Colombo or Taiwan. The shipowner said 380-cst prices were quoted at $104 in South Korea.

In Singapore, 380-cst bunker prices were at $107 per tonne, two dollars above Friday's quotes. Bunker 180-cst was quoted at $110-$112, higher from Friday's $107-$108. MDO was also higher at $193, up from $184/$189. Gasoil was unchanged at $200-$205.
